summary.area:
A Red River College(RRC) student with all As (GPA: 4.23)
A flexible, fast learner, and a supportive leader with the ability to categorize and automate software development process S
Wide knowledge in various areas such as embedded systems, mobile platforms, database, web and application development with one-year experience as an automotive software engineer in a global company
Strong analytical, problem solving, decision making, organizational, time management and multi-tasking skills under high pressure (4 projects at the same time)
Strong interpersonal and communication skills achieved from multi-cultural workplace (Chinese and German)

bullet.major: Application Development, Database management, Web Development, Technology in Business
Electrical, embedded system software and hardware

Model base, manual code, code generation for all standard tools

Proficiency in the use of soldering and measurement equipment such as oscilloscopes and logic analyzer

descriptions.description: Assisted students with programming skills (Web Development 1, Programming 2)
Identified and filled out the students’ learning needs by reasoning and visualization

bullet.title: Instructor
bullet.location: Red River College, Winnipeg, MB, Canada

descriptions.topic: The Day in the Life of an IT Student Technology Camp gives high school students (grades 9-12) hands on experience with fun activities based on the Business Information Technology program.
descriptions.description: Explaned the technologies used in Web Development, Database. Networking and Web Security
Led the discussion about ethical hacking
Instructed the children to build up a simple website with database integrated, to find security holes and to enhance the site security
Offered a promotion and invited by Chinese engineers to be a team leader on Radio Frequency Receiver technology

Discussed with Chinese system engineers on the intermediate sleep/wakeup error that happened on some defective cars; convinced them to deal with the customer to accept my temporary solution to a bad hardware design existing from the first phase
Supported a German system engineer to debug remotely on the NFC prototype
Guided my team members remotely on the first demonstration of NFC in Germany

descriptions.topic: Assisting the instructor in the course Network Computing 1
descriptions.description: Indicated the issues, helped students with troubleshooting and explained network behaviors
Helped students with Cisco Lab exercises in Open Lab periods

descriptions.topic: Prairie Dev Con: A 2-day event provided a high-quality professional development opportunity locally, without the high costs of travel and accommodation typically associated with remote conferences
descriptions.description: Answered questions at the welcome booth
Ensured the machines worked properly

descriptions.topic: The Campus tour: A day tour where international and ESL students come to see the college's facilities and the college lives.
descriptions.description: Invited to come and discuss about the courses and the difficulties of international students at RRC
Gave advise to ESL students about what they could do to prepare for the courses

descriptions.topic: A great event hosted by Microsoft that RRC have had the fun and privilege to assist with for several years.
descriptions.description: Robot Cars:Working with Adafruit Circuit Playground and some common household items, get an introduction to programming and electronics.
Cognitive Thinking: Assist students through a series on non-technical activities to illustrate how they use critical and creative thinking.

bullet.title: Project Team Leader
bullet.location: ACE Project Space, Red River College

descriptions.topic: An Android project sponsored by RRC to improve an inventory system in Canadian stores
descriptions.description: Led the team on the software architecture and kept the software clean and maintainable
Built a two-way peer review process
Trained the team members on Android development and new technologies

descriptions.topic: Series of workshops held by Dylan Fries biweekly to introduce Unity developers’ skill sets
descriptions.description: Set up training materials
Explored digital media world and many pieces of Unity

descriptions.topic: An event held by RRC to provide RRC’s program tour
descriptions.description: Prepared LEGO Mindstorms demonstration
Represented RRC’s students to answer CTV interview questions about LEGO Mindstorms
Led the Coding-And-Networks-Games room, introducing high school students to basic concepts of programming

descriptions.topic: An event sponsored by leading institutes (University of Manitoba, RRC) and the giants in the industry (DELL, INTEL, CISCO, IBM), to explore the future of work.
descriptions.description: Hosted an unconference on how to bridge the digital divides
Took notes in the unconference and reported to the event coordinator
Discussed VR technology and start-up with young talents from high school in Winnipeg
